reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dr. Spacezoo is a challenging but fun indie twin stick shooter with good retro pixel graphics and catchy music. It starts slow as you must learn to resist your ingrained instinct to blow everything up but picks up steam and complexity pretty quickly. The bosses are fun and take different weapons and tactics to overcome.

Recommended for fans of retro twin stick shooter games, even more fun and chaotic with local co-op.

Early Access Review

Amazing game for the long time I have played it throughout its development!
New and awesome turns keep coming up with each new update and I really love the retro 8-bit 2d mashup reminding me of some of the earlier adventure side scrollers I used to play. Can't wait to see what comes about in the future!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun twin stick shooter with a cool twist - blasting your lasers everywhere might work to get rid of your enemies, but if your not careful you'll blow up the helpless space animals you are tasked with saving.

The recent addition of a Permadeath mode is a cool one. Nice to jump in on a session and see how far I can make it (the answer: not very far).

Favorite weapon is probably drunken homing missiles, though it kills pretty much everything when I use it.

Music is very fitting with the funky/quirky vibe of the game's story.

Looking forward to the planned additions!

Early Access Review

Really a fun game!

I enjoyed it as a single player game....  But this thing really shines when you play with other people - it has a chaotic/smash bros sort of vibe to it.  The zoo animals are pretty amusing and each individual level is pretty short and sweet (at least for quite a while).

Also - I had been playing this with WASD & a mouse --> but it is a much funner experience with a twin stick controller.

Product received for free

Early Access Review

Fun shoot 'em up without the linear nature of typical sidescrollers.  Blow up aliens but don't hit the animals.  Would be better with a joystick but was fine with keyboard and mouse.  Levels are starting to get a bit challenging after 12+ or so..
